x = y / 2

x = 10
So, Steven has 10 persecutions more than Jill.

Response:  If after Desprès went to see how many tangerines were collected per day and found that they collected 66 bags per day, then we can deduce that each bag contains 28 tangerines. So, if there are 66 bags per day, then the number of tangerines collected per day is:

$$ Number \ of \ tangerines = Total \ number \ of \ bags \ times \ number \ of \ tangerines \ in \ each \ bag $$

Substituting the values given in the question, we get:

$$ Number \ of \ tangerines = 66 \ times \ 28 $$

Simplifying, we get:

$$ Number \ of \ tangerines = 1840 $$

Therefore, the number of tangerines collected per day is $1840$.

= $2.00

column1: Response:  If they have to travel 1307 feet from the entrance of the cave and the depth of the cave is 919 feet
column2: then we can calculate the distance traveled as follows: Distance = Depth x Height + Entrance x Exit = 919 x 567 + 1307 - 1307 = 482 feet So
column3: the end of the cave is at a distance of 482 feet from the entrance.

column1: Response:  Firstly
column2: we know that the depth of the cave is 460 meters and they are currently at 277 meters. To find out how many more meters they need to travel until reaching the end of the cave
column3: we can subtract their current depth from the total depth: 460 - 277 = 183 meters. Now
column4: if they move at a speed of 17 meters per second (which is equal to 56.67 feet per second)
column5: it will take them: 183 / 17 = 10.69 minutes to reach the end of the cave. Therefore
column6: they will arrive in 10 minutes and 40 seconds.

column1: Response:  We know that they are currently at an altitude of 659 feet and the cave is 762 feet deep. To find out when they will reach the end of the cave
column2: we need to calculate how far they have left to go.  Distance = Depth of the cave - Current altitude = 762 - 659 = 133 feet Now
column3: we need to convert this distance from feet to time. We can use the formula: Time = Distance / Speed Where speed is the rate at which they are climbing. Since they are climbing downwards
column4: their speed is negative. So
column5: let's assume their speed is -100 feet per hour. Time = 133 / (-100) = 1.33 hours Therefore
column6: it will take them approximately 1.33 hours to reach the end of the cave.
